title: introduce torch.Scalar to represent scalars in autograd
body_html:
Currently, scalars are returned in autograd as 1-element Tensors of dim=1.
This has various unintended side effects and issues.
We need to introduce a scalar type into either torch or autograd to avoid the side-effects.

Some of the known side-effects:

  • indexing is infinitely chained: a[0][0][0][0][...]
  • overflows are not handled as expected ( #1389 )

body:
Currently, scalars are returned in autograd as 1-element Tensors of dim=1. 
This has various unintended side effects and issues.
We need to introduce a scalar type into either torch or autograd to avoid the side-effects.

Some of the known side-effects:
- indexing is infinitely chained: a[0][0][0][0][...]
- overflows are not handled as expected ( https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/1389 )
